page.title: 02THE LANDSCAPE
page.content: A zone of settlement from N.W. to S.E. divides this block so that the N.E. and S.W. corners are mainly rural.These areas consist of hills and valleys with much woodland and pasture and a little arable land, some of which stands out in May when the rape-seed has its bright yellow flowers. Several distinct areas occur in the band of settlement. In the S.E. High Brooms is in a valley with its railway, industry, and gas works. In the middle Southborough developed along the main London Road with its line of small shops, surrounded by expanding residential areas of all values. The biggest houses are to the north where they have magnificent views from Bidborough Ridge over the vale of Kent. Bidborough with its old church and houses retains some village character.
